priority.translation[0].definitions[0].d: the thing that you think is most important and that needs attention before anything else
priority.translation[0].definitions[0].e: The club’s priority is to win the League.
After several burglaries in the area, security is now a high priority (=very important and needing attention soon).
With so little money available, repairs must remain a low priority (=not important and not needing attention soon).
The customer is high on our list of priorities.
List your tasks in order of priority (=most important first).
The children are our first priority.
priority.translation[0].definitions[1].d: the right to be given attention first and before other people or things
priority.translation[0].definitions[1].e: I want to start work on the garden but the house must take priority.
Buses should have priority over other road users.
A young person who has finished the course will be given priority over one who has not.
priority.translation[0].note_box[0].head: – Meaning 1: the thing that you think is most important and that needs attention before anything else
priority.translation[0].note_box[0].sect: a high priority
Right now, the environment is a high priority.
an urgent priority
He sees these negotiations as an urgent priority.
a low priority
At that time, architecture was a low priority.
the top/main/number one priority
Controlling spending is his top priority.
the first priority
The first priority for most unemployed people is obtaining a job.
the overriding priority
The reduction of inflation must be the Government’s overriding priority.
somebody’s immediate priority
Their immediate priority was to find somewhere to sleep that night.
a list/set of priorities
Marriage isn’t very high on my list of priorities.
in order of priority
They asked voters to list issues in order of priority.
set priorities
With any new project, it's important to set priorities.
sort out your priorities
If you’ve got a lot of things to do, sort out your priorities.
make something a priority
Lisa had a job, but she'd always made her family the priority.
somebody’s priorities change
As you get older, your priorities may change.
priority.translation[0].note_box[1].head: – Meaning 2: the right to be given attention first and before other people or things
priority.translation[0].note_box[1].sect: Couples may have to decide whose career has priority.
The breakdown services say that women on their own get priority.
Winning the war took priority over everything else.
The hospital always gives priority to emergency cases.
priority.translation[1].definitions[0].e: Members receive priority bookings and reduced ticket prices to all concerts.
priority.translation[2].definitions[0].d: the thing that is more important than anything else, and that needs attention first
priority.translation[2].definitions[0].e: Cost-cutting measures continue to be thefirst priority at the company.
The measures dominated Finland’s economic priorities.
priority.translation[2].definitions[1].d: to be considered more important or needing more attention than anything else and therefore dealt with first
priority.translation[2].definitions[1].e: Workers accepting redundancy will have priority for jobs elsewhere at G.M.
American Express cardholders will be given priority booking at Forte hotels.
Criminal cases take priority over civil suits.
